H0.text: Mass of the soil is the primary determinant of the texture of soil.

H1.text: Water in the soil is the primary factor on which the texture of soil depends.

H2.text: Composition of the soil is what primarily determines the texture of soil.

H3.text: Vegetation growing in the soil is the primary factor that determines the texture of soil.

A4.text: Soils that have a high percentage of sand, such as sandy loam or sandy clay, have a gritty texture. Soils that have a high percentage of silt, such as silty loam or silty clay, feel smooth. Soils that have a high percentage of clay, such as clay loam, have a sticky feel.

A5.text: Soil texture focuses on the particles that are less than two millimeters in diameter which include sand, silt, and clay.
